summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) documenting a voluntary interview conducted on August 4, 2021, with a Supervisory Correctional Systems Specialist from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The memorandum lists numerous attachments, including interview transcripts, emails, and prison logs from August 2019.

events.title: Epstein Death at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein, an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, was found dead. The document references logs and reports from this date as part of the investigation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General was actively investigating the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2021, over two years after the event.
The investigation involved interviewing BOP staff and reviewing a large volume of documentary evidence, including emails, daily logs, and video from the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
Specific BOP employees Tova Noel and Michael Thomas were subjects of 'wellness checks' following Epstein's death, as indicated in an August 18, 2019, email attachment.
